intro: Myosotis commutata, commonly known as the slender blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, sky-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Myosotis commutata is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is considered a herbaceous perennial.
